body:
I couldn't quite reproduce. I am using an ubuntu 14 instance. This is the end of my `sudo pecl install grpc` command:

```
libtool: link: ( cd ".libs" && rm -f "grpc.la" && ln -s "../grpc.la" "grpc.la" )
/bin/sh /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/grpc-1.3.2/libtool --mode=install cp ./grpc.la /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/grpc-1.3.2/modules
libtool: install: cp ./.libs/grpc.so /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/grpc-1.3.2/modules/grpc.so
libtool: install: cp ./.libs/grpc.lai /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/grpc-1.3.2/modules/grpc.la
libtool: finish: PATH="/usr/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/sbin" ldconfig -n /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/grpc-1.3.2/modules
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Libraries have been installed in:
   /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/grpc-1.3.2/modules

If you ever happen to want to link against installed libraries
in a given directory, LIBDIR, you must either use libtool, and
specify the full pathname of the library, or use the `-LLIBDIR'
flag during linking and do at least one of the following:
   - add LIBDIR to the `LD_LIBRARY_PATH' environment variable
     during execution
   - add LIBDIR to the `LD_RUN_PATH' environment variable
     during linking
   - use the `-Wl,-rpath -Wl,LIBDIR' linker flag
   - have your system administrator add LIBDIR to `/etc/ld.so.conf'

See any operating system documentation about shared libraries for
more information, such as the ld(1) and ld.so(8) manual pages.
----------------------------------------------------------------------

Build complete.
Don't forget to run 'make test'.

running: make INSTALL_ROOT="/tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2" install
Installing shared extensions:     /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2/usr/lib/php5/20121212/
running: find "/tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2" | xargs ls -dils
542935     4 drwxr-xr-x 3 root root     4096 Jun  3 23:10 /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2
542956     4 drwxr-xr-x 3 root root     4096 Jun  3 23:10 /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2/usr
542957     4 drwxr-xr-x 3 root root     4096 Jun  3 23:10 /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2/usr/lib
542958     4 drwxr-xr-x 3 root root     4096 Jun  3 23:10 /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2/usr/lib/php5
542959     4 drwxr-xr-x 2 root root     4096 Jun  3 23:10 /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2/usr/lib/php5/20121212
542955 10488 -rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 10736909 Jun  3 23:10 /tmp/pear/temp/pear-build-rootC6goJe/install-grpc-1.3.2/usr/lib/php5/20121212/grpc.so

Build process completed successfully
Installing '/usr/lib/php5/20121212/grpc.so'
install ok: channel://pecl.php.net/grpc-1.3.2
configuration option "php_ini" is not set to php.ini location
You should add "extension=grpc.so" to php.ini
stanleycheung@machine:~$ echo $?
0
stanleycheung@machine:~$ 
```

Couldn't reproduce on a Debian 8 VM either. Tried both `sudo pecl install grpc` and `sudo pecl install -f grpc-1.3.2`.

Anybody else can reproduce this?

I just tried on a new vagrant box with debian 9 (stretch) like this

```
vagrant@stretch:~$ sudo apt-get install php7.0-dev php-pear libz-dev
vagrant@stretch:~$ sudo pecl install -f grpc-1.4.1
vagrant@stretch:~$ echo $?
0
```

So I guess it's something strange with (all) of the debian servers we are running. Do you have any tips on narrowing down the problem?

Since nobody said they could reproduce it I think we can close this issue.
